The photo was shared on social media pla: Twitter, and Instagram, along with a claim supporting Indian farmers.
The image displayed two Coca: Cola bottles with a design that said, "Share a Coke with Kisan Ekta" and "Share a Coke with Support Farmer," indicating solidarity with farmers.
Coca: Cola India confirmed that the image was fake and denied launching any brand campaign related to the issues depicted in the image.
The company had previously launched a: Share a Coke" campaign in 2018, but none of the original bottles mentioned farmers, indicating that the claim was not authentic.
